text:
Hey everyone, I run a marketing agency and am searching for speakers for our client at an upcoming e-commerce event towards the end of February. They have e-commerce marketing technology that uses AI. As of now it's planned to be a hybrid event, hosted in person in Oslo, Norway but also streamed online. We'd love if you could come in person, but is not necessary and can be done online too. We're looking for speakers that:
• Are senior e-commerce marketers or hold a senior position related to e-commerce marketing 
• Are familiar with AI website tools (or are opening to using them and understand their value)
• Have experience with managing large e-commerce websites
• Have a good social media presence on twitter or linkedin for their personal brand (so we can easily promote each other)
We are planning to do a lot of cross-promotion for this event, so we would involve you in that so that your company receives value from your participation. My client is also open to partnerships and potentially even free access to their e-commerce marketing technology. If you're interested or have any further questions, please feel free to email me at <mailto:info@asmarketinagency.com|info@asmarketinagency.com>

text: I had a blast learning from <@U020GLH1U10>. We discuss the golden ratio between branded and SEO content. My main takeaway is that we should focus on ways to write like humans and obsess over team design and distribution strategy. They are doing some awesome things at Mailshake. <https://www.thejuicehq.com/blog/3c-podcast-episode-finding-the-golden-ratio-between-seo-and-branded-content-with-alessandra-colaci-of-mailshake>

attachments.fallback: 3C Podcast Episode: Finding the golden ratio between SEO and branded content with Alessandra Colaci of Mailshake  | The Juice
attachments.title: 3C Podcast Episode: Finding the golden ratio between SEO and branded content with Alessandra Colaci of Mailshake  | The Juice
attachments.text: Alessandra Colaci is the VP of Marketing at Mailshake, is an easy-to-use sales engagement platform for turning cold prospects into warm leads. Brett and Alessandra discuss the golden ratio between SEO and brand content, the 80/20 rule, and the benefits of engaging in Slack communities and building one to one relationships with marketers online.

text: Thanks for having me on the show <@U01JGE01ZA8>! Excited to hear what’s next for The Juice!
